slides.title: Welcome to Tally
slides.content:
# Introduction to Tally Prime

Tally is one of the most popular **accounting software** solutions, widely used by businesses across India and many other countries.

## What You Will Learn

- **Introduction to Tally** - What it is and why it matters
- **Company Creation** - Setting up a new company
- **Ledger Management** - Creating and managing accounts
- **Basic Navigation** - Moving around Tally

## Why Tally?

| Benefit | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| User-Friendly | Easy to learn and use |
| GST Ready | Built-in GST compliance |
| Affordable | Cost-effective for SMEs |
| Reliable | Trusted by millions |
| Versatile | Accounting, inventory, payroll |

## Tally Versions

| Version | Features |
|---------|----------|
| Tally.ERP 9 | Legacy version |
| Tally Prime | Latest version, modern UI |
| Tally Prime Edit Log | Audit trail features |

## Who Uses Tally?

- Small and Medium Enterprises
- Chartered Accountants
- Tax Professionals
- Educational Institutions

> **Tally is the backbone** of Indian business accounting!

slides.title: Creating a Company
slides.content:
# Company Creation in Tally

## Steps to Create a Company

### Path: Gateway of Tally > Create Company

Or use shortcut: **Alt+F3 > Create Company**

## Company Creation Form

```
+----------------------------------+
| Company Creation                 |
+----------------------------------+
| Name: ABC Traders Pvt. Ltd.      |
| Mailing Name: ABC Traders        |
| Address: 123 Main Street         |
| State: Maharashtra               |
| Country: India                   |
| Pincode: 400001                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Financial Year Begins: 1-Apr-23  |
| Books Begins From: 1-Apr-23      |
+----------------------------------+
| Security Control: No             |
| Base Currency: INR               |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Key Fields

| Field | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| Name | Legal company name |
| Financial Year | April to March (India) |
| Books Begin | When to start entries |
| Security | Password protection |
| Currency | Base reporting currency |

## Statutory Information

- GST Registration details
- PAN Number
- TAN Number
- State for GST

## Company Features (F11)

Enable/disable features:
- Inventory management
- Cost centers
- Multiple currencies
- GST compliance

> **Set up company correctly** - it affects all future transactions!

slides.title: Understanding Groups
slides.content:
# Groups in Tally

## What are Groups?

Groups are **categories that organize ledgers** for proper classification in financial statements.

## Pre-Defined Primary Groups

### Capital (Balance Sheet)
- Capital Account
- Reserves and Surplus

### Current Assets
- Bank Accounts
- Cash-in-Hand
- Sundry Debtors
- Stock-in-Hand

### Current Liabilities
- Sundry Creditors
- Duties and Taxes

### Fixed Assets
- Investments

### Loans
- Loans (Liability)
- Secured Loans
- Unsecured Loans

### Income (P&L)
- Sales Accounts
- Direct Income
- Indirect Income

### Expenses (P&L)
- Purchase Accounts
- Direct Expenses
- Indirect Expenses

## Group Hierarchy

```
Primary Group
    |
    +-- Sub-Group 1
    |       |
    |       +-- Sub-Group 1a
    |
    +-- Sub-Group 2
            |
            +-- Ledgers
```

## Creating Groups

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Group

```
Name: Marketing Expenses
Under: Indirect Expenses
```

> **Proper group structure** ensures accurate financial reporting!

slides.title: Creating Ledgers
slides.content:
# Ledger Management

## What is a Ledger?

A ledger is an **individual account** under a group where transactions are recorded.

## Creating a Ledger

**Path:** Gateway > Create > Ledger

### Ledger Creation Form

```
+----------------------------------+
| Ledger Creation                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Name: Rent Expense               |
| Under: Indirect Expenses         |
| Opening Balance: [Leave blank]   |
+----------------------------------+
| Mailing Details:                 |
| Address: [Optional]              |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Common Ledger Types

### Party Ledgers

| Type | Group | Example |
|------|-------|--------|
| Customer | Sundry Debtors | ABC Corp |
| Supplier | Sundry Creditors | XYZ Suppliers |

### Bank Ledgers

| Account | Group |
|---------|-------|
| HDFC Bank | Bank Accounts |
| ICICI Bank | Bank Accounts |

### Expense Ledgers

| Ledger | Group |
|--------|-------|
| Salary | Indirect Expenses |
| Rent | Indirect Expenses |
| Electricity | Indirect Expenses |

### Income Ledgers

| Ledger | Group |
|--------|-------|
| Sales | Sales Accounts |
| Commission | Indirect Income |

## Opening Balances

- Enter for Balance Sheet items
- Required for migration
- Credit for liabilities
- Debit for assets

> **Create all ledgers before transactions!**

slides.title: Voucher Types Overview
slides.content:
# Voucher Types in Tally

## What is a Voucher?

A voucher is a **document that records transactions** in Tally. Each voucher type serves a specific purpose.

## Standard Voucher Types

### Accounting Vouchers

| Type | Shortcut | Purpose |
|------|----------|--------|
| Receipt | F6 | Cash/bank received |
| Payment | F5 | Cash/bank paid |
| Contra | F4 | Bank to cash transfers |
| Journal | F7 | Adjustments, entries |
| Sales | F8 | Sales transactions |
| Purchase | F9 | Purchase transactions |
| Credit Note | Ctrl+F8 | Sales returns |
| Debit Note | Ctrl+F9 | Purchase returns |

### Inventory Vouchers

| Type | Purpose |
|------|--------|
| Stock Journal | Stock transfers |
| Delivery Note | Goods sent |
| Receipt Note | Goods received |
| Physical Stock | Stock verification |

## Voucher Entry Flow

```
Gateway > Vouchers > [Voucher Type]
    |
    v
Date > Particulars > Amount
    |
    v
Narration (optional)
    |
    v
Save (Ctrl+A) or Accept (Enter)
```

## Voucher Numbering

- Automatic or manual
- Can restart for each year
- Prefix and suffix options

> **Use the right voucher type** for each transaction!

slides.title: Journal Vouchers
slides.content:
# Journal Voucher (F7)

## When to Use Journal Vouchers

- Adjusting entries
- Opening balances
- Corrections
- Non-cash transactions
- Depreciation entries

## Journal Entry Example

### Depreciation Entry

```
+----------------------------------+
| Journal Voucher                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Date: 31-Mar-2024                |
+----------------------------------+
| Depreciation (Dr)    Rs. 10,000  |
|   Furniture (Cr)     Rs. 10,000  |
+----------------------------------+
| Narration: Depreciation on       |
| furniture for FY 2023-24         |
+----------------------------------+
```

### Opening Balance Entry

```
+----------------------------------+
| Journal Voucher                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Capital A/c (Cr)     Rs. 500,000 |
| Cash (Dr)            Rs. 100,000 |
| Bank (Dr)            Rs. 300,000 |
| Stock (Dr)           Rs. 100,000 |
+----------------------------------+
| Narration: Opening balances      |
| brought forward                   |
+----------------------------------+
```

### Interest Adjustment

```
+----------------------------------+
| Journal Voucher                  |
+----------------------------------+
| Interest Expense (Dr) Rs. 5,000  |
|   Interest Payable (Cr) Rs. 5,000|
+----------------------------------+
| Narration: Interest accrued on   |
| loan for Q4                       |
+----------------------------------+
```

## Journal Voucher Rules

- Debits must equal Credits
- No cash/bank movement (use Payment/Receipt)
- Date should be correct

> **Journals handle all non-cash adjustments!**

slides.title: Altering and Deleting
slides.content:
# Modifying Data in Tally

## Altering Masters

### Ledger Alteration

**Path:** Gateway > Alter > Ledger

- Change name
- Move to different group
- Update details

### Group Alteration

**Path:** Gateway > Alter > Group

- Rename group
- Change parent group

## Altering Vouchers

### From Day Book

1. Go to Day Book
2. Select the voucher
3. Press Enter to open
4. Make changes
5. Save (Ctrl+A)

### From Ledger

1. Go to Ledger display
2. Drill down to transaction
3. Press Enter to edit
4. Save changes

## Deleting Records

### Delete Voucher

1. Open the voucher
2. Press **Alt+D**
3. Confirm deletion

### Delete Ledger

1. Open ledger in Alter mode
2. Press **Alt+D**
3. Only works if no transactions

## Important Notes

| Scenario | Can Delete? |
|----------|------------|
| Ledger with transactions | No |
| Empty ledger | Yes |
| Voucher in closed period | May need override |

## Audit Trail

Tally Prime Edit Log tracks:
- Who made changes
- When changes were made
- What was changed

> **Be careful when deleting** - some changes cannot be undone!

slides.title: Backup and Restore
slides.content:
# Data Management

## Backup Company Data

**Path:** Gateway > Alt+F3 > Backup

### Backup Process

1. Select company to backup
2. Choose backup location
3. Set backup name
4. Press Enter to start

### Backup Best Practices

| Frequency | When |
|-----------|------|
| Daily | End of each day |
| Weekly | Friday backup |
| Monthly | Month-end |
| Event-based | Before major changes |

## Restore Company Data

**Path:** Gateway > Alt+F3 > Restore

### Restore Process

1. Select backup file
2. Choose restore location
3. Confirm overwrite (if exists)
4. Wait for completion

## Company Data Location

Default path:
```
C:\Tally\Data\<Company Number>
```

## Export and Import

### Export Data

- XML format
- Excel format
- PDF reports

### Import Data

- From Excel with templates
- XML import
- Data migration tools

## Data Security

| Feature | Purpose |
|---------|--------|
| Password | Company access control |
| User Roles | Permission management |
| Audit Log | Change tracking |

> **Regular backups** protect your valuable data!

slides.title: Summary and Key Takeaways
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You have completed the **Basics of Tally** lesson!

## Key Concepts Mastered

### Company Setup
- Create company with correct details
- Set financial year and currency
- Enable required features (F11)

### Masters
- Groups organize ledgers
- Ledgers are individual accounts
- Configure ledgers for GST, banking

### Vouchers
- Receipt (F6), Payment (F5)
- Contra (F4), Journal (F7)
- Sales (F8), Purchase (F9)

### Reports
- Balance Sheet, Profit and Loss
- Trial Balance, Day Book
- Ledger reports

## Quick Reference

| Task | Path/Shortcut |
|------|---------------|
| Create Company | Alt+F3 > Create |
| Create Ledger | Gateway > Create > Ledger |
| Enter Receipt | F6 |
| Enter Payment | F5 |
| View Balance Sheet | Reports > Balance Sheet |
| Backup | Alt+F3 > Backup |

## What is Next?

Explore:
- Accounting in Tally (detailed)
- Inventory Management
- GST and Taxation features

> **You now have the foundation** to use Tally effectively!
